title: Bug 4971: Strange 'copy package'
description: When performing a 'copy package' operation in the package viewer of a project, the destination is not displayed correctly. Instead of showing 'org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui', it displays '2031. org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui in jdt.ui3'. This issue can be observed when selecting 'xxx' as the destination. The expected behavior is for the destination to be displayed correctly as 'org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui'.
OB: When performing a 'copy package' operation in the package viewer of a project and selecting 'xxx' as the destination, '2031. org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui in jdt.ui3' is shown as the destination instead of 'org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui'.
EB: The destination should be displayed correctly as 'org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui'.
SR:
1. Create a new project.
2. Open the package viewer.
3. Select a package in the project (e.g., from the context menu).
4. Choose 'copy' from the context menu.
5. Verify that the destination is displayed incorrectly as '2031. org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui in jdt.ui3' instead of 'org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui'.
